dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freezing wind shutters through the shadows.  Relentless darkness.  No sign of life, save for -- The SOUND of determined footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorman at his post flipping through a magazine, rap music pounding from his radio. Glass suddenly shatters as a gloved hand punches through the window, reaching in, unlocking the front door. Two men in dark suits blur inside.  The doorman rushes to stop them, only -- DEX, the taller of the two men, slams the barrel of his gun into the doorman's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life can be an illusion. (low and deadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes we see what isn't there, and sometimes we don't see what is there. The doorman, wide eyed with terror, nods his consent. Dex removes the gun. Doorman plants himself in the chair, eyes glued to his magazine, making it clear he doesn't 'see' the men as the stroll into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old fashioned steel box struggling its way up the shaft. Fluorescent yellow light stabbing through the grating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dex slaps a small plastic strip on an apartment door as both men turn away, shielding their eyes. A blinding flash of light as the door is blown apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men rush inside and straight into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candles flicker on the dresser.  A syringe on the bedside table, next to a sleeping figure curled up under the sheets. Both men starting to pull guns, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's personal. Dex's partner shrugs, holsters his weapon and steps back through the doorway, watching as -- Dex spins and fires. Not the traditional booming gunfire, but rather the strange sound of electronic hissing as laser-fire rips th person to shreds. Dex finally stops firing and moves to the bed to verify the kill, only on close inspection he sees it's not a person. He's just blown the hell out of a MANNEQUIN. Dex smiles, blows out the candle and heads out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone PRIEST lights the sacrament candles, the sound of his breathing reverberating through the empty church. He suddenly stops, snaps his head around -- A man in a wheelchair stares at him from the doorway. The man is CHRISTOPH.  Dark robes shroud his shriveled, decaying body but his eyes still burn with life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raspy voice which labors to be heard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I trouble you with a confession? Even in the flickering half-light of the candles, the Priest can see that Christoph is dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never a trouble. The large statue of Jesus over the alter staring down as the Priest leads Christoph into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph's voice is weak, knowing each word could be the last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me Father, for I have coveted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you coveted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anguished whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life. A small smile of compassion escapes across the Priest's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God gave us all the need for life. And when the end begins to near, we all crave more time.  No sin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's what I would do for more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do -- A sharp hissing sound -- The laser burns through the confessional wall and straigh through the priest's chest. Face frozen in a listening pose as the body crumples to death. Christoph slowly lowers his weapon with a look of genuine contrition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the near future and the neighborhood is covered with graffiti scrawled in machine code and billboards projecting holographs advertising malt liquor and pleasure-dipped cigarettes. A slick-black JET COPTER drops silently from the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pieces of advanced computer technology lie scattered abou the large work table.  A small kitchen and bedroom in the back. Speakers pour in one of Handel's aching melodies. The music suddenly pierced by the shriek of a giant Bird of Prey diving across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tight knot of bodyguards disgorge from the copter. Tense eyes sweeping the street, they finally give the all clear signal. HALDEN, a charismatic bull of a man, emerges from the copter.  He moves with the confidence of someone who know he can't be touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of Handel's concert mixes with the sound of claws tearing apart flesh. TANNER sits in the middle of the room.  He is early forties, athletic build, and a face that holds too many memories. His insomniac-stained eyes studying the Holographic Chess Board as the knight mounted on the Bird of Prey slaughter a pawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visitors. Tanner snaps his attention to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden and his men head toward the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner's eyes harden at the sight of Halden.  A long beat then he finally shakes his head in resigned disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permit entry. The sound of dead bolts automatically sliding open.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: The bodyguards stand motionless in the corner, doing thei best to look like furniture. Halden moves through the holographic chess board, his eye on Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A legend fell tonight. His stare now ripping into Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unrunnable maze.  Impossible to get through. (thick smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, some kid just danced it like it was some six bit video game. Tanner doesn't blink.  His voice matter-of-fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course the legend would like to think that.  But no one has keys. (fierce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your maze was run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden and his men escort Tanner to the waiting copter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph stands naked in the middle of the vacant street staring down at himself in reverent awe. It is as if he's been reborn.  His body no longer decrepit, but rather pulsing with an almost inhuman vitality. He heads down the street, the walk becoming a run, then a sprint, his head back, mouth open, tasting the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jet-copter screams across the night sky, while inside -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner studies the holographic image of the maze projecte in front of him: A constantly shifting sea of lines swirling furiously in random directions. A small BLUE SQUARE rockets into the maze.  Sound of laughter as the square dodges, feints, spinning it's way down into -- The center of the maze.  A pattern so intricate it seems to be a solid wall of light with no way through -- Only the square suddenly shoots up, twisting, somehow finding the smallest of fissures and blurring through. The square is gone.  Only the laughter remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had fun ripping your maze, that's good. (tight smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that it's obsolete for security purposes, maybe we can turn it into an amusement ride. Tanner silently snaps off the hologram as the jet-copter banks sharply for a landing onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A towering black monolith which seems to burst straight u through the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden leads Tanner down the long hall. Dex, who has traded his dark "assassin's" suit for a VSI standard issue gray pin-stripe, stands waiting for them. He keeps his eyes on Halden, as if Tanner wasn't even there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just tracked the runner to the hotel district. Halden nods as all three of them head into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long rows of programming consoles manned by engineers wearing wireless 'tele-com' headsets. Dex directs Halden's attention to one of the high-def monitors lining the walls.  The monitor showing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rock music pounds the room as silver confetti drops from the ceiling. A KID, sixteen at most, watches excitedly from the bed as the two Playmates, Barbie-Doll bodies, slow-dance a striptease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dex finally acknowledges Tanner's presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still going through puberty and he shreds your maze. (hard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's gotta hurt. Tanner remains silent.  Eyes locked on the monitor as Halden turns to EMMA, VSI's senior security engineer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some internal police there. Tell them to run a perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But have them wait for me 'till they move in on him. Halden turns, shooting him a surprised look.  But Tanner ignores it as he heads for the door. Dex goes to stop him, but something in Tanner's eyes make him think twice about it. A frozen beat, then Halden snaps a silent command to Dex to let Tanner go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows and rows of unconscious bodies strapped to interface seats, the room looks like a warehouse full of people in comas. Tanner climbs into an interface seat as a TECHNICIAN wheels up his medi-cart and starts preparing an IV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't be in that long. The technician shrugs, returns the IV to his cart and starts hooking Tanner to a bio-monitor. Dex strides into the room, staring down at Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been a while since you've been inside. (off Tanner's silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to look up old friends? Tanner meets Dex's stare.  A deadly exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know she asks about you all the time -- Tanner plunges his finger into the CONNECT BOX, his eyes thrusting back in his head, body going slack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool silent blackness of the void. Eternal stretch of nothingness. Then the blink of a light racing toward us. Colors so intense you can feel their heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destination?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hotel district. The faintest sounds can be heard.  Almost sounds like music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security clearance approved. Welcome Tanner.  Enjoy your stay. Dropping down.  Into the lights.  Embraced by the colors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as if someone took the best parts of the world's night spots and put them together in one neon-drenched city. Only this is the digital world. Picture-perfect architecture.  No pollution or decay.  An colors that are just a little bit more vibrant than the real world. Music pounds the air as crowds of people roam the streets exploring the countless pubs, casinos and night clubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner heads down a street lined with some of the world's most famous hotels. Unlike the partying people all around him, Tanner is all business, staring straight ahead with laser-like intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of INTERNAL COPS wearing tele-com's and Night Cit Police uniforms, stand huddled in the shadows across from The Savoy. The SERGEANT greets Tanner with a curt nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corp must really want this guy to have sent the legend himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just didn't want you boys having all the fun. The sergeant gives the signal.  The cops fan out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid's still on the bed, sucking down a beer.  One of the Playmates leans over, lets him unhook her bra. He smiles at her overly perfect body. She bites her lip in staged ecstasy, tracing her fingers down his chest, pulling at his belt as -- The door burst open.  The cops and Tanner rush inside. The kid flies off the bed. A cop tries to grab him, only the kid grabs a chair and SMASHES it hard into the cop's face, dropping him hard to the floor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop's real body lies strapped to an interface seat, twitching as the pain sears through his consciousness --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other cops ready to charge, but Tanner gets in front of them, freezing the kid with a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we're going to trace you. The confetti still swirling through the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So be smart about this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You're the big man.  Big fucking cop. He laughs as he makes an imaginary 'gun' with his fingers and points it at Tanner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No guns on the system.  That's how it's programmed, right? (pulls the 'trigger')

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you going to do, huh big cop?  Can't shoot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know you didn't run it.  You had keys. Kid shakes his head, full of bravado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That maze's nothing.  I could run it blind on a sixty-meg board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a waste of time.  How about a little encouragement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the room watching the scene playing out in th hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's something which ought to help him talk -- Her fingers race over the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner still has the kid pinned with his stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, you ran it.  That's felony system fraud.  Gets you thirty years. (lets that sink-in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you tell us where you got the keys and we start talking a deal. Kid's eyes reveal he's thinking this one through, only -- A huge DOBERMAN explodes through the window. Insane growl, deadly stare, rocketing for the Kid, who freaks, throwing one of the Virtual Playmates into its path -- Powerful claws rips through her, flinging her against the wall.  She lies there shredded, but for some reason, not bleeding. Kid throws himself out the window.  Doberman flies after him, with Tanner just a heartbeat behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid races down the crowded street with the Doberman chasing after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose the God-Damn dog! A couple crosses the street, getting between the kid and the dog --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma slams in the commands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doberman about to tear through the couple, but flickers, then disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slightly featureless waiters and waitresses deliver drinks.  On stage, a young Billy Holiday belts out a soulful blues tune. The kid tears through the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops rush into the casino.  But Tanner stays on the street, racing around the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The casino is now up on the monitor.  Emma's eyes following the kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grid eighteen.  Heading for exit six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops charge across the casino, but unable to get to the kid before he bolts out the exit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid comes flying out into the alley.  There's Tanner, bearing down on him. Kid takes off, running as fast as he can, turning the corner to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sprawling structure where people enter and exit Night City. A crush of excited customers pushing past the HOSTESS who welcomes them with programmed cheerfulness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't miss The Tivoli, with fireworks every hour on the hour. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And please remember to follow all safety rules while -- The kid racing through the crowd with Tanner in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound of rock music bouncing off the buildings. The kid sprints out of the crowd and up and over a hill. Tanner follows, finding himself in the midst of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A colored light show screaming down from the heavens. The huge crowd of people gyrating to the music pounding from the band on the river-front stage. Tanner pushes into the frenzy as an USHER quickly steps u to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very politely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry sir, but there is a premium charge for this event -- Tanner pulls his ACCESS CARD from his pocket and runs it through the thin slot in the usher's torso.  A beat, before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Access approved.  Enjoy the concert, Tanner. The usher steps away as Tanner slices through the crowd, eyes probing for the kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma is studying the monitor, trying to find the kid in the churning sea of humanity --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band finishes the song.  The audience yelling for mor as the light show suddenly snaps off -- Pitch blackness. A new song.  Even louder.  Audience screaming along as strobe lights rip through the night. Tanner trying to focus in the quick bursts of illumination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's north-east of you.  Heading to Crimson street -- Tanner spins, cutting a path through the throng.  Picking up speed.  But suddenly freezes -- A face.  KATIE.  Effortlessly attractive.  The warmest of smiles not quite able to hide the sadness. Her expensively dressed male companion's arm wrapped tightly around her waist as they watch the concert. Tanner stares at her.  Doing everything he can to hold it in. The lights strobing her face.  Tanner struggles to pull his eyes away.  Only now she looks over.  Sees him. They stare at each other for a long tortured beat. Katie turns to her companion, whispers something, then hurries over to Tanner.  Only he's no longer there. Her eyes spinning through the crowd.  Catches a glimpse o Tanner as he disappears into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid breaks out of the concert crowd.  Races up the street and over a bridge to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Modeled after Amsterdam.  Canal-lined streets brimming with businesses catering to every and any erotic desire. Kid comes running off the bridge and suddenly stops.  A pair of cops charging him.  The kid turns, rushing into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Customers browse the ten stories worth of Virtual Playmates enclosed in small glass cubicles. The cops push through the crowd, racing after the kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner sprints for the fire escape on the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid racing for an exit, but can't find one.  The cops almost to him, so he bolts straight for a cubicle -- Covering his face, he throws himself through the glass, flying past the stunned Playmate and out the cubicle's back door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid charges up the stairs to the top floor and out onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid throws the door shut behind him as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to be smart. Kid spins.  Tanner is right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too late to cut a deal. (coaxing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you've got to do is tell me where you got -- The kid backs away from Tanner, but quickly runs out of roof, teetering on the edge of a ten story drop. A frozen beat, then the kid looks up at Tanner with a twisted grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: DON'T --
dialogues.text: But the kid's already laughing as he lets himself fall backward into the air. Tanner dives after him, smashing face-first into the roof grabbing the kid's foot before it disappears over the edge. He reels the kid back onto the roof, slamming his stare into him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't one of those virtual reality systems you're used to playing on! The kid shrugs, unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is hyper-reality.  Full Immersion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big deal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- If you had come in through the gates like you were supposed to, you'd know. (intense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full Immersion.  You die on this system, your consciousness dies. The kid stares at Tanner as this sinks in.  But he still keeps up his tough guy look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell do you care? Tanner wipes the blood from his chin as he rips all trace of compassion from his face, matching the kid's stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.  I just need you alive so you can tell me where you got the keys. Tanner hurls the kid back into the arms of the waiting cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trace him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be my pleasure. They drag the kid down the stairs, leaving Tanner alone o the roof, sound of music swirling through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An engineer studying his screen as location grids flash by. One of the grids suddenly freezes. The engineer punches a command into his console, enlargin the grid to show a cross-section of city streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner heads down the crowded street toward the flashing lights of the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner stands on the outskirts of the concert, staring into the area where he had seen Katie. The strobe lights flashing across his face. He finally forces himself to turn away from it, heading alone down the street,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner. Frozen beat.  Katie steps from the shadows. A long, tortured silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least you could do is say hello. He slowly looks at her.  Working hard to keep it under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. This isn't easy for either of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What brings you inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleaning up a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (small smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things never change, do they? Sees the dried blood on his chin.  Old reflexes taking over, she puts a soothing hand on his face. He stands rigid.  Barely breathing.  Forces himself to turn away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner. Her eyes plead into his.  Takes everything he's got to remain firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. He heads down the street.  She calls after him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I wanted to tell you, but they wouldn't let me -- But he's already disappeared into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowded joint watching as the late blues legend 'Howling Wolf', lets lose on stage. Tanner finds a spot at the bar and orders a drink, his eyes still dark with memories. The drink arrives.  As Tanner picks it up, a drop of bloo falls from his chin, crimson spot smearing through the amber liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good luck.  Means your real. Tanner looks next to him at -- GENA, sexy, chatty, sense of longing.  She motions to the employees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The programs don't bleed. Tanner nods, waits a polite beat, then turns back around, taking a hit of his drink, but she's still talking to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you plugged-in from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm South Dakota. She sips from her drink, eyes still on Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you gotta love about this place.  Drink whatever you want, your real body doesn't gain an once. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you wanna know what's a drag? He drains his drink and motions for a refill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph stands outside, watching them through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gena leans in toward Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always a warm summer night.  Which is a shame, because there's nothing like making love in the rain. (flirty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you agree? He looks at her, not sure how to respond.  She reads the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman you're stuck on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no -- His tele-com buzzing, then Emma's voice in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nailed the trace.  Kid's in Memphis. Tanner talks into the tele-com.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, kick him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?  We can handle collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma is watching Tanner and Gena on a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I don't want to interrupt anything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You're not.  Kick me out. Emma shrugs, turns to the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner motions the bartender to refill Gena's drink, tossing down credit to cover it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care?  Where the hell are you going -- He flickers, then disappears into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last thing Tanner sees is Gena's insulted face blurring into the swerve of lights bending into each othe as -- Tanner is pulled out into the blackness of the net. Eternal silence.  Finally -- A shaft of light slices the darkness. Eerie green glow, the echoing sound of an electronic heartbeat. Struggling to make out images.  A line smearing up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner blinking back to consciousness.  The weaving line is on the bio-monitor tracking his vitals. A bored technician unplugs him from the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just lay there a few minutes. But Tanner forces himself to get up.  His chin shows no sign of the wound received in the digital world. He looks around groggily at the sea of motionless people plugged into the system.  Place feels like a morgue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph moves straight for the now-empty seat next to Gena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First light streaks peacefully through the windows. The place is sparsely furnished.  Empty beer kegs are use as chairs and textbooks lie scattered about. The stillness is shattered as -- The front door explodes open -- Heavily armored MEMPHIS SWAT TEAM rushing in, along with Dex and a couple of VSI security guys -- Weapons drawn, everybody's dead serious. Tanner follows them in, watching as they rip through the place, kicking in doors, searching everything, until finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from basement)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down here! Everyone rushes down into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid lies unconscious on a cot, his fingers stuck in a connect-box wired to an old laptop computer. Swat team leader starts to pull the kid up off the cot, but Dex's hand shoots out, stopping him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad idea. Dex whips a mini-cell phone from his pocket.  Swat leader turns a confused eye to Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull him off the system before he's ejected and he goes brain dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got him.  Kick him lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid is sitting in the middle of a black cube.  He suddenly flickers, then disappears --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid's body twitches.  Eyes fluttering open.  First impulse is to run, but as his focus sharpens -- A wall of laser guns trained on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph settles into the seat next to Gena.  He orders drink, then turns his attention to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might I interest you in a question? She turns, gives him the once over, then flashes him a playful smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as it's not 'what's your sign?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could meet God, what would you say to him? She stares at him.  He's serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a strange question.  You a strange man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are, sitting next to the creator, what do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how you pick up women --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- No. The intensity in his stare unsettles her.  But something about it keeps her from moving away.  She looks at him, shrugging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd probably say something like why'd you let the world get so fucked-up? He nods, eyes aching with compassion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your life that bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not me, I've been lucky.  But I've seen what happens to other people --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- If your life's so good up there Gena, what are you doing down here? She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know my name? His drink arrives as he calmly meets her stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe in miracles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious, how did you know my name? He smiles, dangerous charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (toasting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To miracles. She's still staring at him, not exactly sure what to make of this guy, but intrigued enough to join him in the toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm has finally arrived.  The jet-copter slashing through the dark rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner is holed up in the back with the kid's laptop computer.  Programs racing down the screen. He stops on a program, eyes blazing in vindication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flawless gothic architecture complete with Gargoyles growing down from the roof. The building is dark and seemingly empty save for the outdoor glass elevator climbing up its side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gena and Christoph stand next to each other in the elevator, staring down through the window at the firework raining over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night City's digital carnival. A roller coaster with no track, cars rocketing through thin air over a merry-go-around with real horses. The carnival is surrounded by The Track, where people rac Ferrari's at full speed. One of the cars loses control, hurtling toward the wall, but freezes at the last second to allow the driver to climb out unhurt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gena turns, catching the flicker of almost child-like awe in Christoph's eyes as he looks out over Night City. She smiles, moving a little closer to him.  The elevator glides to a stop.  He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what? The doors open and he leads her out onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brass bed surrounded by unlit candles sits in the midst of the elegantly designed roof garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making love in the rain. She looks from the bed to him, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it doesn't rain here -- The first raindrops beginning to fall as -- Sultry jazz music envelopes them.  The candle wicks crackle to life, flames dancing in the night. Gena's stunned, shaking her head, insisting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't rain here.  Not the way it's programmed. Her eyes dart out over the roof.  It's not raining anywhere else.  Just here on the roof.  Just on them. She stares at him, fascination mixed with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone who believes in miracles. He pulls her to him, warm rain caressing their bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jet-copter twists down through the rain for a landing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden's office is on the top floor of the building, windows offering up God's eye view of the storm battered Manhattan. Tanner marches in and before Halden can react, slams a mini-disk into the wall player. A matrix of data swirls down the wall monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recognize it? Halden's silent.  Tanner's stare digging into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid had keys. (matter-of-fact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maze is unrunnable. Halden is still silent, a sour eye on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't make sense.  How the hell does some fucking teenager get to the keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I just design the maze. (tight smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping the keys secure is your job. He turns for the door as the monitor buzzes, now showing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid sits like a statue in his chair.  He doesn't look up as the VSI LAWYER enters and takes a seat across from him. The lawyer stares at the kid as if this could somehow mak him break down and confess.  Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care to tell us how you came into possession of an illegal access program?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm doing mute 'till I have a mouthpiece here who's on my side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need a lawyer. (holds up the disk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found the program on your laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner has stopped in the doorway, his eyes on the monitor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid stares impassively at the lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do. (dead serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the only shot you've got of keeping your ass from sinking in a sea of shit is to tell me where you got this program. The kid shakes his head, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.  No point to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you'll never believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me. The kid slowly stops laughing, his voice seemingly genuine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My uni-net account.  I log on.  The program's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden is still watching at the monitor, not noticing as Tanner turns and silently slips out into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voices playing from the monitor are just barely audible as Tanner heads down the long hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea how the program got there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell do I know?  Maybe it was a gift from God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain streaming down on Christoph and Gena as they have sex. She studies him.  His eyes are burning with intensity, savoring each and every sensation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have much sex up there in the real world, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Hard to tell if it's rain or tears which streak down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner moves through the dark rain and into the waiting -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner climbs in, practically having to yell to be heard over the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninth and Hudson. The PILOT punches it up on the nav-board.  The location popping-up on the grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell's Kitchen.  Talk about your shit holes.  What's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My home. Takes the pilot a full beat to realize Tanner isn't joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to cover)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheap rents.  Close to the waterfront.  I hear the area's making a comeback. He quickly turns his attention to engaging the thrusters. Tanner stares straight ahead, watching the rain slam into the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has stopped raining.  Gena lies asleep on the bed.  Sh is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thrusters groaning to life.  High-pitched whine, almost sounding like laughter. Tanner is watching the blasts of rain battering the windows. The jet-copter twisting up into the sky. A rain drop zig-zags across the windshield, running into another droplet, making one single, bigger drop racing down the glass. Tanner staring at the windshield.  Suddenly realizing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Land it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me back down. Pilot shrugs, floats the copter back down to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner rushes through the control room to Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need playback on the kid's run. She reads the urgency in his voice and pulls it up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A holographic image of the maze.  The glowing blue square racing through it, accompanied by the unmistakable sound of laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze it. (she does)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now pull-up play-back of the kid's interrogation. A beat.  The maze replaced by VSI'S interrogation room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do.  And the only shot you've got of keeping your ass from sinking in a sea of shit is to tell me where you got this program. The kid starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze it -- The lawyer and the kid suddenly motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner staring at the kid's frozen image on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you isolate and voice-print the last sixty audio-bits of both play- backs? Emma punches in the command. The sound of the kid's laughing, playing alongside the sound of laughter from the maze run. Tanner staring at the voice prints on the audio-board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better get Halden down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph hurries down the street, the sound of nearby partying echoing all around him. He turns the corner, finding himself in a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A holographic map of Night City shimmers in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are here. (a red X glows on the map)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To reach the club district simply turn around and head east on Crimson Street. (dotted lines show the path)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To reach the Mardi Gras, simply -- Christoph reaches through the holograph, sliding an acces card into an all but invisible slot in the wall. The map disappears as the wall slides open.  Christoph heads through the opening --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph's voice echoing through the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights. The lights snap on, revealing Christoph standing at the entrance of a long utility tunnel which snakes down under the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden, Dex, and Tanner watch as Emma plays back the maze run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the runner's laugh. Emma plays back the kid's interrogation.  The kid laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the kid's laugh. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ran voice-print.  It's not the same person. Everyone stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph sprints through the tunnel.  It winds around into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large room full of reserve employees. Motionless waiters, bartenders, playmates and bellhops stacked along long racks, staring out into space with empty eyes. Christoph races through the room to the stairs in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden still staring at Tanner, realizing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two maze runners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone sends the kid a copy of the access program, then runs the maze at the same time the kid does, using the same codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that way, the system only registers a single runner. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go after the kid, leaving the other person free and clear to do whatever the hell they want. A long terrified beat for this to sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph rushes down the stairs and into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of GUARDS stand sentry in front of a large door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need to see your work orders, sir -- Christoph nods, slamming his fist into the guard's wind- pipe with deadly force, then spins, snapping the second guard's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard's flesh and blood bodies twitching, then fall still as the bio-monitors tracking their brain activity FLATLINES. An ALARM pounding the room. Medical technicians rush to the bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warning light erupting on a console.  A stunned enginee staring at his screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Internals down right outside the Nexus. The room spins silent.  Everyone staring at the monitor which shows the two guards laying dead on the floor. Halden snaps at Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up the Nexus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph punches numbers into the door's keypad.  A buzzing, then the door opens for him. He pulls a HOODED MASK from his pocket, throwing it over his head as he rushes inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large room dominated by a web of catwalks providing access to the several stories worth of program panels lining the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone staring at the monitor as the hooded intruder races down a catwalk and opens a program panel. Inside is a program keyboard and screen.  The intruder begins typing on the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, he's interfacing. Tanner spins to Halden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eject the system!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumps in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a choice, he's interfacing with a core program --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Trying to interface. Halden nods, siding with Dex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't get through the security codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Emma)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get every cop who's in the area. Tell them to rip this fucker out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't be time if he gets access --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He won't. His tone clearly indicating end of discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph, still wearing the hooded mask, whistles the Lord's Hymn as his fingers dance across the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Internal Police in position --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Send 'em in! Several dozen Internal Cops rush in through the door -- Christoph's up above them on a catwalk -- The cops sprinting up the stairs after him -- Christoph typing as fast as he can, furiously trying to break through the security codes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's eyes glued to the monitors.  Watching the cops split into two groups. Christoph's in the middle of a catwalk. Cops charge him from either direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph's fingers blurring over the keyboard -- The cops getting closer and closer -- Christoph typing as fast as he can -- The cops are just heartbeats away -- Nothing Christoph can do -- Suddenly stops typing -- Smallest flicker of a smile. Spins to face one of the charging groups of cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. LASER CANNON materializing in Christoph's hands -- The cop's face frozen in stunned terror. Laser cannon erupts -- Blasts through the cops -- Sharp screams of pain as bodies drop -- Christoph spins.  Fires on the other group --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The internal cops' real bodies lined up in their interfac seats. One by one, down the line, twitching, like some grotesque Rockettes show.  Screen monitoring brain activity flatlining -- ALARMS pounding the room. Medical technicians rushing to bodies.  But nothing can b done. The cops suffering full cerebellum arrest.  Instant brain death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watching the massacre in stunned horror.  Tanner the first to react, yelling at the engineer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eject the System! Engineer turns to Halden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it! Engineer reaches for his command console. Dex spins, flash of steel, laser hissing -- Burns a neat hole in the back of the engineer's head, dropping him dead. Halden whips around, staring at Dex, shocked. The control room's security force pulling lasers on Dex, but he ignores them as he fires into the eject console -- Sparks fly as metal disintegrates.  Twisted remains of circuitry. Security guards open up fire, lasers carving up Dex's body -- Dex dies, face frozen in a jeering smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  None of the cops alive to scream. Christoph's surrounded by twisted bodies, blood pooling a his feet. His eyes burning in genuine anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner spins to an engineer, motioning to Christoph's image on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run a trace. Engineer nods, begins the trace. Tanner stares down at Dex's corpse, then up at Halden --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had access to the keys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yes. Halden moves away, that's all he's going to say. The engineer looks up at Tanner, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy's got one hell of a relay going. He motions to the multiple grids popping-up on the screen Each grid showing a different location from around the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have to search through each possible grid to find him.  It's going to take a while. Tanner studying the screen as if it were a chess board. Long beat, before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grid fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the most recursive.  Take the longest to search. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's smart, that's where he is. Engineer shrugs, might as well try.  Eliminates the rest of the grids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope he's smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph turns back to the program panel and punches in commands.  He moves with the confident sense of someone who has total control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden stands over Emma, watching as she inspects the smoking remains of the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long 'till we can eject?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have to reconfigure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least a day. Not what Halden wanted to hear.  For the first time, a look of real panic in his eyes. The engineer snaps his eyes up to Tanner, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called it.  Dead center in the grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far away? The tracing matrix flashing a single-point coordinate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred and sixty-one kilometers. Tanner and Halden exchange a look.  Smallest flicker of hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can be there in fifteen minutes and rip him off the system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner and the assault team rush to the waiting jet- copters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph has resumed humming the Lord's Hymn.  His fingers racing over the keyboard, causing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hell to break lose.  Alarms POUNDING the room. Monitors going blank, engineers punching keys in futile frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's locked-it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely sealed-off.  No one gets in and no one gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: System's running on pure auxiliary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long? Emma's eyes spin down to a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just over two million people plugged-in. (runs the calculations)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: System can run seven hours before it crashes. Slowly looks up at Halden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then everyone dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The copter clawing its way through the savage storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph strips off his mask and grabs a tele-com from a fallen cop.  He calmly turns to the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put on Halden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma tries to hand her tele-com to Halden, but he's froze in place, eyes locked on the monitor. Christoph, on the monitor, smiles at Halden. Halden looks like he's staring at a ghost.  Finally takes Emma's tele-com.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Halden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden, how nice to hear your voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have found in life that what one wants isn't nearly as important as what one needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to take back what's mine. Halden stares at him, trying to keep his voice calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two million people in there with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have nothing to do with this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Two million people lost in the digital night.  What do they seek? Christoph waits for an answer.  None is offered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they seek escape?  The comfort of eternal night?  Or perhaps it's more. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unanswered sins.  The taste of death. He turns to the keyboard, programming --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small burst of fire falls from the corner of the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flames drift down, searing straight through the roof --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is packed full of people.  The fire swirling down, looking like part of the light show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph's watching the night club on his monitor.  A flicker of private torment in his eyes at what he knows i coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flames drift down onto a YOUNG WOMAN -- Dropping her to the dance floor, writhing in tortured anguish. She yells for help through the slowest of death as the flames burn through her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The San Francisco VSI public interface center sits perche under the shadows of Coit Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of customers lie motionless in interface seats. The soft glow of bio-monitors checking vital signs. One of the monitors begins to buzz. Several MEDICAL TECHNICIANS rush over, whipping a curtain around the interface seat. It's the young woman from the night club. Her eyes thrust back in her head, body contorting in searing pain.  Then finally, mercifully, it's over. Her body limp, bio-monitors showing her brain activity flatlined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More fire cascades down through the roof. The dancers screaming in panic, pushing and shoving to ge out of there but the doors lock, trapping them inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden's watching on the monitor as the flames rain down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God-Damn you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I believe he has --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You've made your point!  You've got control of the system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph nods, punching in commands for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire flickers, then disappears.  No one else has to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph turns back from the keyboard, looking out at Halden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But instincts are so hard to over- ride. (matter-of-fact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours will be to try and send someone in to stop me. Halden says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The system's locked-up, so the only way in is through the maze. (stares at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is why I've changed it.  Your access program will no longer work. He scoops up the laser cannon, aiming for a program panel Halden's mind spinning, trying one last tact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: System's running on auxiliary.  Only seven hours before it crashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in there.  Everybody dies, you go with them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But don't you remember? (pointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already dead. He spins, laser cannon HISSING. Destroys the program panel, causing the rest of the control room's monitors to plunge into darkness. Sudden, eerie silence as the corporation is now completel cut off from Night City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jet-copter shuddering through the storm.  Lightning slashing at the night. Pilot's eyes on the nav-grid.  Flashing red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tanner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're right above him. Search lights pounding the darkness.  Glinting off some large metal object.  It looks like a steeple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jet-copter drops through the tempest, landing in the field across from the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powerful search lights screaming through the stained glas windows, washing the church in an ethereal mosaic of color. The sounds of the storm crashing into the walls. A flash of lightning revealing the doors and windows have all been rigged with trip wire booby traps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner leads the assault team as they rush across the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors crash open as Tanner and the men charge in. The trip wires broken. An explosion -- Of sound as organ music suddenly blares out. Recording of a choir kicking in, heavenly voices blasting from all directions. The assault team standing rigid in place, staring up at - Christoph hanging crucifixion style from the blood- streaked cross. He is dead, a wire running from his finger down to a portable computer on the alter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden hurries down the hallway with Emma at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have communications contact all interface centers.  Tell them due to high demand, we're at full capacity and so temporarily there's no room for anyone else on the system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the customers with reservations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the staff apologize profusely and issue credit vouchers. (adamant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But remember, it's a capacity problem.  That's all. Emma nods, understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And send someone through the maze. She stares at him, not sure she heard this right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maze has been changed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He says the maze has been changed. I need to know for sure. He turns the corner, disappearing out the door before she can respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assault team takes Christoph's corpse off the cross and lays him out on the alter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at Tanner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you were just talking to this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well feel this fucker's skin. Ice cold. (trying to understand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guarantee you this sonofabitch's been dead at least half a day. A beat for this to sink in.  Everybody staring at Christoph's corpse like they were looking at the Devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph punches a command into the keyboard.  Bodies an the blood disappear, leaving no sign of the killing. Sound of clapping.  Christoph whirls.  It's Dex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the perks of paradise.  So easy to hide your guilt. Both men stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, I'm not the one who chose this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, so which one of us does that make the coward? A deadly smile on Christoph's lips as he lets this one go He turns and heads down the catwalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfinished business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about the reconfiguration?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect opportunity for you to demonstrate your continued worth. Christoph disappears down the stairs. Dex leans over the railing, waiting until Christoph comes out onto the ground floor, yelling to him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure he's going to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if he doesn't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He will. He heads out through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma watches as an ENGINEER climbs into an interface seat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to run the whole thing.  Just probe the first few seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of cake. He gives her a thumbs-up, no point in showing the fear. Then sticks his finger into the connect-box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackness of the void. A blink of a light.  Colorless.  Racing into the maze -- An explosion of color and shapes hurtling all around with blurring speed -- The engineer navigates around the first corner, cutting a safe path, the "keys" seeming to be working, only -- Suddenly everything shifting.  Get the hell out of there. Only behind him, the maze morphing -- Dizzying design of color.  Breath-taking beauty.  Closing in on him.  Nowhere to run -- Flash of bright light. The sound of a tortured SCREAM. Then nothing.  Silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has started to slow. The assault team's outside, smoking cigarettes, bullshitting with each other, trying to forget what they saw in there, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner probes through Christoph's blood stained computer. Stops on a program.  Complex codes flashing down the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voice activate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Program name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resurrection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Describe program function. A soft whir as the machine checks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resurrection. Tanner stares at the codes, his face torn with revulsion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dex stands alone in the middle of the Nexus. He punches a command into the programming panel, causing the small roll of fat to disappear from his gut. He smiles in satisfaction, then throws in another command His hair thickening, flecks of gray evaporating. He enters one last command.  Last fifteen years of lines melting from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roar of a jet-copter fills the church. Tanner snaps his eyes out a window.  Halden and his men pouring from the copter. Tanner whips his attention back to the computer, talking as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transmit copy of program via satellite north uplink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destination?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner-eighteen-six-two-nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is dark and empty. The storm crashing against the windows as the wall monito snaps on to the garbled sound of machines talking to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner stares out the window, watching as Halden and company rush toward the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connection approved.  Ready to transmit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Transmit now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The program codes racing down the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden and his men head straight for the alter, staring down at Christoph's corpse in disgust. Tanner's eyes burning into Halden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had no right! Halden calmly turns to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're jumping to conclusions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not plugged-into the system. He's in the fucking system! Halden doesn't argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell do you think you are -- Halden snaps a silent command for his men to clear out. He waits until they're out the door before turning back t Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We caught him working on neural map transfers.  We dug through his system.  He was trying to transfer genetic modules into data-molds. His employment was instantly terminated. (seemingly genuine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporate hands are clean. Tanner's eyes dig into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph had spinal cancer.  His body kept rejecting gene therapy. He was desperate. (insists)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was him, it wasn't us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I saw the program. This freezes Halden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporate fingerprints all over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course they are. (explains)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph was stealing every piece of code he could get his hands on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you weren't involved. It takes all of Tanner's energy to hold back the rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because why the hell would you be interested in a program that allows people to live inside your machines? (locks eyes with him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean how much profit could there possibly be from owning the universe and selling space in it to people who are dying, or people who are just God-Damned sick of this world --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Come on, you know F.C.O. regs. Anyone caught with their R and D hand in the bio-digitization cookie jar spends the rest of their life in federal penitentiary. (swears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not worth it. Tanner studies Halden for several long beats, then shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're loosing your touch. (pointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used to be a hell of a lot harder to know when you're lying. He turns and heads for the door as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sealed-off the system. Tanner doesn't stop, almost near the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way to eject it is from the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got the keys, send someone in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Christoph changed the maze. This freezes Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need someone who can run it blind. Search lights blare through the stained glass windows, smearing Tanner's face in color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two million people in there, Tanner. Tanner slowly turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if the system crashes, they all get to spend the rest of their lives hooked-up to God-Damn coma machines. Tanner stares at him.  No choice.  Halden smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth. Halden studies Tanner.  No negotiation.  Halden's smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The penthouse apartment is completely barren except for a beige couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enlarge to one-hundred and seventy. The couch increases in size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bump to one-hundred and eighty. The couch gets a little bigger. Christoph sits on the floor, studying the image of a couc which flickers on the screen of the small rectangular viewer he holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off-white pleats. The pleats appear on the couch across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden escorts Tanner down the corridor. A small knot of GUARDS stand rigidly in front of an office.  Halden nods to them and they unlock the door, stepping away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden motions Tanner into Christoph's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly as Christoph left it. The office is perfectly clean and organized. A dialysis machine next to the desk.  Several computers. Wall size monitor. Tanner looks through the desk.  A couple of disks.  Empty morphine vials.  A hypodermic.  Not much else. The work table dominated by a scaled model of a building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Terrace.  First building Christoph ever programmed for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not used for anything. Tanner looks up at him for an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph was a brilliant programmer, but very eccentric. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He insisted it be kept vacant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't say. Tanner stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment is now fully furnished in perfect Park Avenue chic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph sits in an antique chair across from the large canopy bed, staring in rapt fascination at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various unconnected images flash by in dream-like quality A young freckled-face boy being tucked into bed. A rat-hole of an apartment, broken windows, and blood stained walls. Two teenage boys with baseball bats beat the shit out of young girl. A sickly looking man taking a shower. A black dress is pulled from a store rack, a hand turning around the tag so the price can be seen.  The dress is quickly put back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph looks up from the viewer, his eyes sliding to the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden watches as Tanner probes through Christoph's computer files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph was in charge of designing building modules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what's with all the staffing programs in his account?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question. Tanner looks up, but Halden isn't going to give him any help on this one. The computer screen flashing images of waiters, waitresses, hosts, playmates, bell-boys. Tanner staring at the pictures of digital employees whipping across the screen, slowly realizing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Modules. He stares back up at Halden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes you a long time to build a staffing program from the bottom up. Halden's not saying a damn word.  Tanner looks disgusted as he puts it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a hell of a lot easier to digitize a real person, then strip them down to a module you can use to make as many employee programs as you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, in theory, I suppose that would work. But Tanner isn't interested in theory, his eyes tearing into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did he digitize?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to yourself.  Digitization. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that officially that's a pure fantasy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Who did he digitize?! A frozen beat, then Halden meets Tanner's stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph had complete autonomy. (seemingly genuine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I didn't want to know. He snaps off the computer, signaling the end of the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The candle-opera has been placed on the dresser, bathing the room in golden light. Gena materializes on the bed.  She is naked. She looks around the room disorientated. A long beat, then she climbs to her feet, moving unsteadily across the hardwood floor.  It is almost as if she is drunk. She freezes as she catches her reflection in the mirror. She looks surprised that she is naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet is full of clothes.  She stares at them with a puzzled expression, then pulls a dress off a hanger. It is the black dress that was seen in the viewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma stands in front of the interface room, waiting for Tanner and Halden as they head down the hallway toward her. She holds up a mini-disk for Tanner to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sending you in with a top- level access card.  It'll get you into every program, including the core. Halden locks eyes with Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously, not something Christoph should get his hands on. Tanner nods as they head inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma leads them across the room to an interface seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've rigged the card so it should stay attached to you as you run the maze. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So once you materialize inside, it should be on the ground right next to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. She loads the mini-disk into the interface seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the access card it should be easy.  All you've got to do is get into the core program and hot-wire the eject sequence. (warns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But be prepared, it'll be a hard eject -- A technician wheels up his medi-cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the infrastructure gets dumped, then everyone's ripped out into the net. Tanner nods, then turns his attention to the technician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrenaline.  140 cc's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filling the syringe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man likes his juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And once I'm through, bring me down fast with Dexaline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you get through... Emma shoots him a hard look.  Technician shrugs, calls it as he sees it. Tanner rolls up his sleeve as he climbs into the interfac seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it -- The technician sticks the needle into Tanner's arm. Only a beat before the adrenaline hits Tanner's system. His body shaking, eyes rolling back in his head. The technician eyes the bio-monitor, waiting until Tanner is peaking before plunging Tanner's finger into the connect-box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slice of color racing toward us.  Hyper-fast. Tanner hurtling toward it.  Explosion of light.  Blinding intensity. Tanner rips through the maze, navigating at dizzying spee through the interlocking patterns. Dodging and twisting through the blur of obstacles. Under it all, a sound.  Almost a voice.  Female.  Too feint to hear.  Calling out 'Tanner'. Dropping down.  Into the maze's heart.  Lines slamming at him.  No way to beat it, only he's -- Spinning between the lines.  Always changing.  Too fast t see.  Making it down into -- The center of the maze. An intricate pattern so dense it looks like a solid, impenetrable wall of light -- The wall collapsing in on Tanner.  No escape -- He rockets straight into it.  Inevitable death -- Only he screams straight up, twisting, spinning, hurtling through the tinniest of fractures and out the other side into -- Nothingness.  Empty blackness. Then the muffled sound of breathing.  Dull thud of a heartbeat, followed by music.  Louder and louder.  A hard driving samba. A thick mist covering fluttering images. There are people here.  Too many of them.  Screaming.  A hideous sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner materializing in the midst of the pulsing street party. Ornate costumes.  Vivid colors.  Crush of celebrants gyrating to the music. The ACCESS CARD materializes on the ground next to him. Tanner picks up the card, his eyes blinking, fighting for clarity. But the adrenaline pounding his vision.  Everything distorted.  Grotesque... A face cuts through the chaos.  Angelic beauty.  Katie -- Tanner stares at her.  She sees him, face breaking into a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gena, wearing the black dress, stumbles out of the bedroo and around the living room in growing confusion. Christoph sits on the couch, calmly watching her. She finally turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all here...
