dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She shakes her head, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's everything.  Everything I've seen.  Everything I've wanted... (barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only I know about all of this -- Her eyes suddenly frozen at the photos on the mantle. They're her photos.  Baby picture.  High school graduation.  Wedding photo. She is beginning to tremble. The doorbell rings. Several digital waiters and waitresses head out of the kitchen, carrying silver trays of hor d'oeuvres and champagne. Christoph stands, kissing Gena on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like you always wanted. A digital jazz band materializes in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of South Dakota and move to New York where you can throw cocktail parties in your Park Avenue apartment. She's trying to process all of this, but it's too overwhelming.  The only words she can manage are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the grace of this world. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's impossible. The doorbell rings again.  He motions to her bare feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better get some shoes on. He turns to answer the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The medical technician's eyes are glued to the bio- monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He made it!  Son-of-a-bitch actually ran it! Emma's eyes involuntarily flick down to her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just under five hours left before it crashes. Halden's face is impassive, revealing nothing. The medical technician shoots Tanner up with dexaline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner is still fighting his way to Katie.  She's laughing, urging him on. The dexaline starting to clear his consciousness. He's finally able to focus.  The street.  Buildings.  And Katie.  Only it's not Katie. Just someone that looks a little like her.  The woman laughing with her companion. Tanner stands frozen in the middle of the street.  He looks out of place.  Haunted eyes in the midst of wild celebration. He quickly turns and heads out of the square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a dozen well-dressed GUESTS stand waiting outside. They all hold invitations. The door opens and Christoph greets them with a warm smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, come on in. As they head into the apartment, the elevator arrives in the hall, bringing more people. Christoph ushers in this new group, then slips into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gena still stands barefooted in the middle of the room. The band starts up, pouring sultry jazz throughout the room. More and more people are filtering inside.  Gena stands there rigid, a sense of growing panic in her eyes. She can feel people beginning to stare at her. Someone pops open a champagne bottle.  Sound of laughter. More guests arrive.  A man in the corner smiles at her, beckoning her over. She backs away from him, moving unsteadily through the party and out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gena remains asleep on the brass bed. The sound of distant jazz music fills the air, waking her up. As her eyes open, she sees Christoph heading silently toward her.  He motions for her to close her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, go back to sleep. But something about his voice sets her on edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, go back to sleep. But she sees the glint of steel in his hand.  The laser h has hidden down by his side. She bolts upright --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?! He looks uncomfortable, this isn't a confrontation he was expecting.  Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the dream. She doesn't know what the hell he's talking about and she doesn't want to know.  She flies off the bed, only -- He moves with blurring speed, grabbing her, throwing her back onto the bed.  She's pleading now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fucking do this.  I've got a son.  I'm all he's got.  So don't you dare fucking do this -- Hissing of a laser. Burns a hole right between her eyes. A blood trickle smearing the mattress. Christoph's face is a study in anguish. The jazz music still bathing the roof.  He whips around. Gena stands across the roof staring at him.  The digitize Gena, the one who is barefooted and wearing the black dress. She is shaking, her face white as a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all been transferred. She doesn't understand.  He moves to her, his voice impassioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Genetic codes.  Consciousness. Unconsciousness.  Every single dream.  Every kiss, real or imagined.  The shadows of her soul. It's all in you. She stares at him, her voice trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To live forever. His face burns with compassion as he explains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People plug-into this world, but remain linked to their flesh and blood body.  Such an encumbrance. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if their bodies are kept on machines, nourished by IV's, the laws of nature eventually will be respected.  The body grows old and dies.  Then they're gone from both worlds. Somewhere deep inside, she is beginning to understand. But it brings her no comfort. Christoph heads for the elevator, motioning for her to follow.  But she doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said I have a son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she said she had a son. (quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a dream she once called life. She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come I can't remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I took it out of your memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spins on her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Because there'll be no remorse. Not in my world. A private darkness in his eyes as he turns and disappears into the elevator, leaving her alone on the roof. The sound of partying echoing through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner moves down the crowded street, passing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A growing mob of angry people bottlenecked out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gates are temporarily closed for routine maintenance.  But they will reopen soon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Been saying that for an hour, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't be much longer. (cheerful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we do appreciate your patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I need to get back now.  I've got to pick my kids up from school! The hostess keeps smiling, it's all she's programmed to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To help make the short wait more enjoyable, drinks are on the house across the street at Dante's Tavern. But there are no takers.  Everyone keeping their place in line as these people need to get home. Tanner cuts through the crowd, his eyes burning with determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner moves pass the carnival and is about to turn the corner, but stops as he catches a glimpse of a familiar building. The Terrace is right across the street. The building is dark except for the flashing lights from the top floor. Tanner stares up at the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marbled lobby is like a museum.  Priceless paintings and tapestries fill the walls. Tanner heads through the lobby and into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes the button for the penthouse. The elevator glides effortlessly up the side of the building. The colored lights of Night City swirling through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner slowly steps inside.  He's tensed, not really knowing what to expect. The party is in full-swing.  Someone offers Tanner champagne but he declines. He looks around the room, his eyes stopping on the mantle He picks up one of the photos of Gena --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looking for her? Tanner looks up at the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She went up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner moves slowly across the roof, the candles throwing flickering images across his face. He stops at the brass bed.  It is empty save for the bloo stain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work for them, don't you. Tanner spins.  The digital Gena sits in the corner.  She tries to force a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would explain your little disappearing act in the bar. He takes a slow, cautious step toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He works for them too, doesn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sonofabitch who did this. She pierces her arm with a broach pin.  She doesn't bleed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet shame)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not real, am I? He stares at her, doesn't know the answer to that one. She meets his stare, terrified of the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I can't go back, can I? Tanner wishes he could lie.  But can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. She absorbs this in steely silence.  Longest of beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He failed. She stares at him, trying to keep back the emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making a sandwich.  Just like my mom would.  It's raining outside. The sandwich isn't for me.  It's for him.  And that makes me feel something. (barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No words for it.  But I'll never forget. Her eyes are wet.  Her voice coming out in a tortured whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the memories around him are still there... He watches her, tormented by the fact that he can't find anything comforting to say. She turns her eyes out into the night, giving him silent permission to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator deposits Tanner down on the street as the Tivoli's fireworks show starts overhead. Colored explosions raining down as Tanner disappears into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner heads into the alley.  A holographic map of Night City shimmers in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are here. (red X glows on the map)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To reach the club district, simply turn around and head -- Tanner reaches through the holograph, sliding his access card into the slot on the wall. The map disappears as the wall opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner's voice calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights. The lights flicker on as Tanner races down the tunnel, sprinting around the bend and into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The long rows of storage racks are empty, the reserve employees no longer there. Tanner stares uneasily at the barren racks as he makes hi way through the room and down the stairs into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner slides his access card into the door.  It opens fo him, revealing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is buzzing with activity. Dex supervises an army of digital employees as they move across the catwalks rewiring the program panels with cables. Tanner silently slips into the room and up the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner makes his way up around the corner, suddenly comin face to face with a WAITER -- Only unlike the usual polite cheerfulness programmed into Night City's waiters, this guy has been given a hard, glaring face. The waiter pulls his laser -- Tanner hurls himself forward, knocking both of them to th floor. It's Tanner who manages to come up with the gun. The waiter squeezing Tanner's throat with savage force as Tanner fires, again and again. The waiter twitching, then falling motionless.  His body sliced with holes but not bleeding. Tanner pockets the gun and heads up the stairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The catwalk is crawling with digital employees, all of them armed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner takes a deep breath, then walks right out onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner walks briskly, eyes down on the steel grating, assuming the attitude of someone who belongs there. He opens a program panel, typing commands into the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food and service program sub-six. Access codes required. Tanner pulls out his access card and slides it into the panel. A clicking sound as data glitters across the screen. Tanner steals a quick look around. Dex is heading out onto the catwalk.  He has his back turned to Tanner and hasn't seen him yet. Tanner spins back to the program, data still whipping across the screen.  Tanner silently urges it on, faster and faster. And finally it buzzes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Access granted. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Male or female?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Male.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiter, busboy, Maitre-De --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Waiter. Dex is now turning in Tanner's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard, modern, upscale --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Standard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scanning body type. Tanner turns to the wall, trying to keep his face hidden as Dex approaches. Long frozen beat. Dex is almost right on top of him -- The program buzzes -- Tanner is now wearing a waiter's uniform. Dex's hand slams down on the back of Tanner's shoulder -- Tanner tenses, hand reaching for his laser, only -- Dex twists Tanner's head so it's looking up at the open program panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep this one shut, we're not wiring it. Tanner nods, keeping his back turned to him. Dex moves on, continuing with his inspection.  Tanner pulls the access card from the program and heads back to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner, still in a waiter's uniform, heads up to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to another program panel and opens it, typing into the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Core program.  Access codes required. Tanner starts to slide in the access card but freezes. Still heartbeat.  Tanner whirls to the side. CHRISTOPH is a hair's breath away.  Perfectly still.  Cal smile of someone who's been standing there a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An honor.  The legend visits. Tanner's hand dives for his laser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mistake -- Tanner is fast.  But Christoph's a blur.  Beyond human speed. Snaps the laser from Tanner's hand and flings it harmlessly down the catwalk. Christoph turns, regarding Tanner with genuine respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maker of the perfect maze. Impossible to run.  So many try, none succeed.  Yet, you're here. (impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You succeeded. Tanner stares at him, trying to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patterns were moved around, but they weren't changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True.  But why? He lets the question hang there, then takes a step toward Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden sent men to kill me in my sleep, but simple illusions won out. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he now sends the legend to finish the deed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what? Tanner is silent.  Christoph's eyes burn into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eject the system? Christoph steps even closer.  Tanner can feel his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what would happen to me?  I have no body to return to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So wrong -- He moves so fast, impossible for Tanner to react. Picks up Tanner and hurls him down the catwalk. Tanner crashes hard into the steel grating.  Searing pain as he fights for a breath. He sees his laser not that far away. Tanner lunges, one fluid motion, grabs the laser, spins and fires -- Only Christoph is no longer there. Tanner's shot burning through a wall. Christoph is now on the other side of Tanner.  Foot blurring down, pinning Tanner's gun hand to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not die.  Not again. (intense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the perks of divinity. Tanner stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not a God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here I am. No bravado in how he says it.  Merely a statement of fact

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God creates man, man creates technology, technology creates God. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End into beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a computer program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not real? His foot suddenly smashing into Tanner's gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pain is real. Rips a STEEL POLE from the railing and slams it into Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deliciously real. He pulls Tanner to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I kill you? Dangles Tanner over the railing.  Hell of a drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your body could live up there.  But on a machine.  No mind.  No dreams. (hisses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me this isn't real. Silence.  Pain spasms through Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. A frozen beat.  Then Christoph pulls Tanner back up to th catwalk. KATIE is there. Tanner stares at her.  She starts to say something but Christoph stops her cold with a look, then turns to Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a kind man, your employer. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allowing you to fall in love with a program. Katie can no longer look at Tanner, her eyes down on the grating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she wasn't a designed program. Not this angel. (reverently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We digitized her from flesh and blood. His eyes flick from Katie to Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to tell you, but Halden wouldn't allow it.  His nature demands no lose ends. (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the flesh and blood Katie was killed. Tanner's face is a mask, revealing nothing.  Christoph locks eyes with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet she lives on in here, mind, body and soul. His stare now ripping into Tanner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you of all people, should know this world is just as real, if not more than the nightmare you call the real world. (disgust)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People praying to Gods who don't listen.  Violence and decay.  No rhyme or reason.  To be young and told you are dying.  Nothing can be done.  Promise of life gone.  That will never happen here. Tanner meets his stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the one who was dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Tanner's eyes burn with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sealed off the system.  When it crashes, everyone dies with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but only in the dream they call life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dream?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all dreams, no matter how appealing, must eventually end. Tanner stares at him as if looking at insanity. Christoph smiles, eerie calm as he turns to close the ope program panel. Tanner dives with savage speed, grabbing the laser from the ground. The Nexus Center erupts with the SOUND of people pulling guns --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner -- Hundreds of lasers being trained on Tanner -- Tanner grabs Christoph, using him as a shield, the laser jammed into Christoph's back. Only Christoph fades away.  Just like that. Tanner standing exposed on the catwalk. The sound of lasers FIRING. Tanner racing for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph materializes next to Dex, watching up above as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lasers carve the air around Tanner. Hissing and popping as chunks of metal disintegrate. Tanner dives across the catwalk, throwing himself down into the relative safety of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner pulls his laser as he races down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph grabs Dex's gun and calmly fires into a program panel. The panel sparks, circuitry destroyed, causing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stairs to flicker, then disappear.  Tanner falling through empty space --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner crashes hard to the ground with an explosion of pain. He comes up limping as laser fire slams all around him, H hurls himself through the door and out into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to run but his leg buckles, sending him sprawlin to the floor.  He picks himself up, clawing his way up th stairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner is forcing himself to limp-run down the hallway, pushing himself as fast as he can. Behind him, he can hear the footsteps of Dex and the men quickly gaining on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party has migrated to the roof. The digital Gena stands silently in the corner, staring out at the people.  They all seem so happy. She grabs a glass of wine from a passing waiter. She moves out into the center of the roof, drinking the wine and swaying to the jazz music. Several of the single men trying to establish eye contact with her. She begins to smile.  It's the kind of smile that could turn to tears at any moment. A dreamy look on her face as she walks across the party and straight off the roof. Falling through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her bloodless body laying twisted on the ground. The soft breeze tugging at her coat, opening it enough to see the photo nestled against her chest. It's a photo of Gena as a small child.  The saddest of smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner heads out through the alley and into the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes searching for a place to hide.  Sees the dance club across the street. Tanner limps for the club as Dex and his men come screaming out of the alley in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strobe lights slash the darkness. Swirling sea of people. Loud, angry, music. Hard to make out faces in the flashes of illumination. Tanner tries to lose himself in the anonymity of the crowd. Christoph has joined Dex and the men as they slice throug the club, eyes darting back and forth. Tanner angles for the rear exit. A slam-dancer crashes into him, sending him sprawling to the floor. Christoph cutting across the club toward Tanner. Tanner tries to stand but can't, his leg no longer able t hold his weight. He sees Christoph heading toward him. Tanner trying to scramble out of the way. Christoph's eyes are scanning the faces around him, and i appears he doesn't see Tanner down on the floor. The song ends, people stop dancing. Tanner finds a table and holes up under it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner allows himself a deep breath. A sudden EXPLOSION of sound. Tanner spins, laser pointed. But it's just the next song starting.  Tanner exhales. The table is no longer there. Christoph has ripped it off the ground and flung it out onto the dance floor. Tanner swings the laser around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden's little killer, who -- Tanner FIRES! The shot slams through Christoph's face but does absolutely no damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't kill a God. Tanner fires again.  And again. The shots hit Christoph but don't hurt him. Christoph reaches down, pulling Tanner to his feet. Dex and the rest of the men crowd around, guns drawn. Christoph kisses Tanner on the check, then steps away. Tanner looking for a place to run to, but he's surrounded Dex and the men firing -- Music drowning out all sound. Strobe lights carving quick bursts of images. Laser fire slamming through Tanner -- Hit from all sides.  Again and again -- His eyes straining to hold on to life. Muzzle flashes.  More shots.  Tanner's body twisting. Music screaming down from the heavens. Lasers ripping through his body. Eyes finally going blank as he crumples to the floor. Christoph motions to Dex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His access card. Dex bends down for it, but suddenly freezes -- There's no blood. Not one single drop. Dex whips his eyes up to Christoph in stunned realization --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son-of-a-bitch digitized himself! But Christoph's no longer there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real Tanner stands on the catwalk, plugging his acces card into the core program panel. Data swirls across the screen.  Several long beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Access approved. Tanner begins punching in the eject command. Codes streaking down the screen. He suddenly stops, grabs his laser and whirls. A person in the shadows. Tanner is about to shoot when the person steps forward. It's Katie.  Standing very still.  Watching him. His gun aimed at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to do this? He slowly lowers the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone you have to get back to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She nods, her eyes aching.  She steps toward him, struggling for the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked Christoph to take it out of my memory. Data smearing down the program screen, reflected off her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he wouldn't. Her voice is suddenly very small and vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So every single time I close my eyes it's there.  All of it. Searching his face.  Afraid of the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You? Long beat.  The words crawling from his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember. She slowly reaches out.  Touching his face.  So familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it better than whatever you have waiting for you up there? He doesn't answer, his body suddenly shaking.  A tortured silence. Her lips reaching for his. Christoph materializing on the catwalk -- Rushing for Tanner.  Speed of a Demon -- Tanner no longer thinking, merely reacting, spinning and slamming in the last of the eject command --

dialogues.speaker: NO --
dialogues.text: But it's too late. The god-awful noise, quickly getting louder and louder. The sound of the end. The walls disappearing. Katie's eyes locked on Tanner, trying hard to be brave, but it finds a way out of her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens to me -- He wishes he knew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon and stars fade away. Then the buildings.  Only the people left. The LIGHT screaming for them.  Everyone it touches, blasted into emptiness. There is no escape from the light, it finds everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light explodes through. It touches Christoph first, ripping him into darkness. Then Katie. Then Tanner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a still heartbeat, Katie's face is visible -- Before it smears into the silent blackness of the net as -- Tanner is hurled into the darkness, spinning toward the blink of cold colors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain hasn't let up.  Blanketing the city in wet darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner's eyes fighting open. The room is full of shadows.  Very eerie. The sound of rain slamming against windows. Tanner forces himself to sit. The shadows come into focus. They are empty interface chairs.  Tanner is alone.  He reaches down, ejecting the mini-disk from the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner uses the wall for balance as he pushes himself dow the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the button for the top floor.  His eyes starting to clear as the rage burns through the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark. Halden is behind his desk, staring out the window at the storm. The faintest of sounds.  Halden doesn't look surprised. Tanner is in the doorway.  Dead silence. Halden's face erupts in one continual grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was never a doubt, buddy! Tanner steps into the office, slamming shut the door behind him. Halden keeps that grin plastered on his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner comes through! Tanner heads straight for him.  Smell of violence. Still smiling, Halden's on his feet.  A laser trained on Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need the disk back, then we can put this whole thing behind us -- Tanner rips away the weapon with savage speed, then grabs Halden by the wind-pipe and slams him back against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was real! Halden trying to say something, but all that comes out is some awful garbled noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son-of-a-bitch! Halden's face turning weird shades of red.  Then touches of blue.  Eyes going slack. Tanner finally lets go.  Halden collapses, hacking for air.  A while to suck in enough to get out words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not his style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie was digitized. Halden nods.  Tanner stares down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you had her killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To hide the evidence. Halden climbs to his feet, struggling to regain some semblance of authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drugged her.  So she wouldn't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no need to kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Tanner, think this through. Tanner levels the laser on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has no memory of it.  She won't know who you are. Tanner's face tightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time I ask.  Where is she? Halden stares at Tanner.  Tanner will pull the trigger. Halden blurts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An interface attendant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Times Square. Tanner nods, then fires the laser, again and again into - The window.  Blows out the glass.  Tanner hurls the gun out into the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner hurries for the elevator.  Halden charging after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last piece of business. Tanner doesn't stop.  Elevator doors opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need the disk back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insurance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up the disk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's alive, you get it back. He zips the disk into his jacket pocket as he steps into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner jabs at the button.  The doors sliding shut. Last thing Tanner sees is Halden's smiling face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget, Tanner. (amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't know who the hell you are -- Door close.  Tanner is alone.  Halden's words echoing around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A solid sheet of rain drenching the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain seems even worse, pounding the neon-strobed hell hole. It's a mob scene outside of the VSI Interface Center. Aftermath of the system being ejected. Tanner slices through the crowd, fighting his way inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small handful of overwhelmed VSI employees passing out credit vouchers to a crush of angry customers. Tanner moves through the crowd, searching, but not finding. Working his way to the center, looking everywhere, and finally -- Katie. In the back corner.  Managing to keep a professional calm as she hands out vouchers. Tanner is so close now he could touch her.  She turns to him.  Waiting for something.  Then finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry sir, we need your debit card before we can issue a credit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet intensity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Katie. His eyes burning into her's.  She looks at him, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you? Long beat.  Truth tearing at him.  Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance Stanworth.  His father's station wagon and sixteen year-old promises. She tenses, studying his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went to my high-school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how do you know about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? The patrons thrusting debit cards in her face.  He practically has to yell to be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother told you your father died in a car crash. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't until you left for college that your uncle finally told you the truth. She's staring at him.  No longer noticing anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most nights you wake up crying. Never knowing why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?! He motions toward the back.  Away from the people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie and Tanner stand alone in the open doorway. Outside, the storm smothers the empty alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We worked together on the inside. You were on my programming team --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night City. She stares at him like he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been inside. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My synapses wouldn't connect.  They say it happens with some people. A still silence as he's suddenly not sure he should tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He eyes the ground.  Rivulets of light reflected off the black water. Her voice pounds into him.  Needs to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me -- He grabs her arm, pulling her out into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark storm battering them as he leads her into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Antiseptic light drips down onto the newest telecommunications toys.  Salaried men and women crowd th terminals. Tanner leads Katie to the back.  Old fashioned color Xero machine in the corner.  He grabs a price list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took you. Slams the paper into the machine.  Punches the button. Machine kicks out the Xerox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And made a copy. Holds up the two pieces of paper, side by side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identical.  One's you.  One's digital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not possible.  No one can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporation can. This hangs there.  Katie fighting back believing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why they told you you can't go inside. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't have you running into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her? He holds up the Xerox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. Katie stares at it, trembling, barely holding on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner and Katie in the back.  She's still struggling to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said we were on the same programming team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't know anything about programming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once they digitized you, they added it. She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? Tanner's face darkens.  Working hard to stay emotionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To see how long it would take for me to realize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realize?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't real. She's still staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how long did it take you? His voice is suddenly very small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had to tell me. He's suddenly no longer looking at her.  But her eyes remain frozen on him.  Starting to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was more than work, wasn't it? A long beat before he finally forces himself to meet her stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it meant something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She nods, her eyes aching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what that's like. He's looking at her.  Like he's done so many times.  Then he kisses her. She pulls away.  Shaking, trying to say something, but it won't come out, so she kisses him back. A terrified connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muted light sifts through the windows. The door slides open.  Tanner and Katie silently enter. Her mouth on his as she tugs at his jacket.  It falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candles.  Get candles. She waits as he heads into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears apart the cupboards.  Finds several mismatched candles.  Grabs matches, returning to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's empty.  His coat has been picked up and neatly hung on the hook.  He moves into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie's sitting on the bed, staring at him with trembling eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretend I'm her.  We're inside. (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me what it was like. Sound of rain slamming into the window.  He lights the candles, throwing wicked shadows across the room. He turns to the bed looking down at her. Flicker of emotion.  So much held back. Falls down on top of her.  Both fully clothed.  His mouth tracing the lines of her neck.  Her breaths coming faster His hands roaming her body.  Raw passion. She flips him over, climbing on top.  Kissing him. Hungry.  But suddenly stopping. Staring at him in troubled silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way you kiss me. SOUND of the rain drilling the metal walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you've done it so many times. He stares up at her, not sure how to answer. Her voice wrapped in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you.  A copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference? The rain drumming against the windows. A jet-copter screams by overhead. He's like a statue, watching her. Something burns deep in her eyes. Moves her mouth down to his. He's not breathing.  Just staring at her. She kisses him.  He erupts -- Throws her off of him -- Blurring into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claws through the drawer for a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He returns to the bed.  She sees the knife in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on -- He grabs her arm.  Her eyes now locked on his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you want to do this? He raises the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because this time can be different. (pleads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time we can stay together -- The blade flashes down, piercing her flesh. No blood.  Not one single drop.  She suddenly won't look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes to his jacket, unzips the pocket, reaches inside.  It's empty.  No disk. Whirls around.  Katie staring at him from the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no other choice. He comes at her.  Eyes wild.  Deadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of this was real! Her voice now trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do love you. She flickers.  Tears staining her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than I should. Then she's no longer there. Tanner is standing alone in the middle of the room. Eyes pounding with rage. He spins, punching through the window! Hand bloodied, keeps punching, harder and harder, until there's no more glass left. But the rain doesn't come into the room.  Stopped by some invisible barrier. A primal scream ripping from his throat. Taste of the beast. He attacks the walls, clawing them down into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't let you eject the system. Tanner whirls.  Christoph stands across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I've seen the world you would have returned them to. He steps toward Tanner, voice ripped with anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I have too much compassion for that. Tanner slams his stare into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this world doesn't last! Christoph calmly meets Tanner's stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it could? The question hangs there as the walls dissolve into nothingness, plunging them into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz music pierces the darkness. Then a flicker of light, expanding out to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is gone.  Tanner and Christoph stand alone on the roof, the lights of Night City spread out before them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we take it out onto the net? The question hangs there.  Tanner shakes his head, couldn't have heard it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlimited energy out there.  Enough to run this world for all eternity --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But you'll never be able to get it through the maze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  Of course not. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you're here. He locks eyes with Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your maze.  You designed it.  You can lead us through it. Terrified understanding beginning to flash through Tanner's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes to deliver them from a land of affliction and bring them to a good land, a land flowing with milk and honey. There is a sense of almost relief in Christoph's eyes. The secret finally told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the energy from the net, we can program this world anyway we want. (beams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redwood forests.  Oceans. Mountains --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Two million people plugged-in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Tanner is horrified at putting it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't let them go. Christoph says nothing.  Tanner's eyes bore into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until you're on the net where the corporation can't touch you, you can't open the system.  They'll eject it if you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One would assume so. The fireworks show starts up over the carnival down below Tanner doesn't seem to notice, his eyes frozen on Christoph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But once the system touches the net, all links are severed. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only up there in the dream they called life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And down here -- Christoph holds up the access card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Thanks to you, we can reconfigure the system to free up enough power to digitize everybody who is plugged-in.  Every last soul... (intense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And bring them to a better world. Tanner's eyes glow with fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I refuse? Christoph calmly meets Tanner's stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the system crashes. (matter-of-fact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have let two million people die. He fades away.  Leaving Tanner standing alone on the roof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are crowded with people heading in and out of bars. The fireworks from the carnival raining down overhead. Nobody noticing the small clouds creeping in over the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner stares out at the slowly approaching clouds. Tormented realization tearing at his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner rides the elevator down the side of the building. He watches through the window as more clouds drift overhead. The elevator glides to a stop, depositing Tanner out onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads out into the middle of the street. Huge explosions tear apart the darkness as the fireworks boom across the sky. In the quick bursts of light Tanner can see the clouds ar getting darker and darker. The air filled with the screams of people riding the digital roller coaster. The first drops of rain beginning to swirl lazily to the ground. People stopping what they're doing and staring up into th sky.  Stunned that it's actually raining. Tanner instinctively pushing through the crowd, yelling -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get inside!  Get back inside! But no one paying him any attention. The rain coming down harder now. More and more people pouring out onto the streets as word begins to circulate that it's raining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dex and Christoph stand silently in front of a program panel, watching the monitor across the room which shows -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner is still fighting his way through the crowd. Up above, the fireworks explode in the rain, creating prisms of flickering color. Tanner suddenly freezes.  Sees -- Katie across the street.  She is watching him.  Tears in her eyes. And then it happens. A horrific SOUND roars across the sky. Hard to tell if it's thunder or laughter, as -- The clouds unleash their rage. The storm ripping apart the night.  Rain as thick as steel. Knocking people to their knees.  Struggling to stand. And it keeps coming.  Slamming down harder and harder. Threatening to wash the whole damn city away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph pulls his eyes away from the monitor. A long beat, then he silently nods to Dex, who punches th commands into the program panel. Christoph keeps his stare away from the monitor, not wanting to watch as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The savage rain storm continues as a small burst of fire falls from the sky. The flames swirl through the rain. Tanner, like the crowds all around him, is pinned to the ground by the crush of water. The balls of flames burn right through him -- His body convulsing on the ground in anguished pain -- He is probably screaming, but it would be in vain as the storm drowns out all noise --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A peaceful street in the downtown area, dominated by VSI' Chicago Public Interface Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows and rows of people strapped unconscious to interface seats. An alarm pierces the room. A Medical Technician rushes to the sound, sweeping a curtain around the person.  Takes one look down at the person, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need help here! The bulking man in the interface seat is in the throes of violent spasms, his eyes thrust dangerously back in his head. Then mercifully, it's over.  He flatlines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner struggles to his feet, the rain crashing down on him. He fights his way over to Katie -- Flames now falling from every square inch of sky. A solid blanket of death floating down onto the city. Tanner locks eyes with Katie, screaming as loud as he can --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph as God! It is impossible to tell if she can hear him over the howling tempest. But there is the slightest shift in her face.  Some tortured realization. Tanner turns back into the street. The flames drifting down through the rain.  Only heartbeats away from hitting the people. Tanner stares straight up into the heavens, screaming --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough!  They will not die --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relief spills through Christoph's face as he turns to the program panel and throws in the commands for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flames disappear.  Just like that. Then the storm stops. A silent stillness. The crowds in the street still shaking, not yet willing t believe it's really over. The first glint of light as the night fades. For the first time ever, the sun rises over the Night City.  Dawn in the new world. Tanner and Katie flicker, then fade away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner and Katie materialize on the --

dialogues.speaker: FIFTH FLOOR CATWALK
dialogues.text: They are flanked by Christoph and Dex, along with an army of armed digital employees. Katie silently stares at Tanner.  Something being communicated. Christoph smiles at Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Moses said, 'Who am I, that I should lead them to the Promise Land?' Tanner turns and stares at him in steely silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine minutes before the system crashes. Tanner's eyes reflexively spin down the catwalk toward th core program. Christoph holds up the access card --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have access to it.  You can't eject. (dead serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the only way everybody lives is out on the net. Tanner catches a quick glimpse of Katie as she slips through the guards and down the stairs. Dex motions to the program panel in front of Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This program interface will get you into the maze. The longest beat.  Then Tanner nods.

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH FLOOR CATWALK
dialogues.text: Katie rushes to a program panel and throws it open, punching in commands.  Data whips across the screen.

dialogues.speaker: FIFTH FLOOR CATWALK
dialogues.text: Christoph hands the access card to Dex who in turn slides it into the program panel in front of Tanner. Several long beats, then the program buzzes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Access approved. Dex pulls out the card as Tanner calls out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now -- His hands rocket out with blurring speed.  One hand grabbing the card as the other grasps onto the program panel --

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH FLOOR CATWALK
dialogues.text: Katie slams in the last of the commands --

dialogues.speaker: FIFTH FLOOR CATWALK
dialogues.text: The catwalk flickers, then disappears. Christoph, Dex, and the digital employees plunging down through thin air. Tanner hanging onto the panel --

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH FLOOR CATWALK
dialogues.text: Katie punches in more commands and now --

dialogues.speaker: FIFTH FLOOR CATWALK
dialogues.text: The catwalk reappears.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Christoph, Dex, and the men crash hard to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: FIFTH FLOOR CATWALK
dialogues.text: Tanner races down the catwalk to a program panel.  He throws in the access card.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Christoph is the first one to his feet.  His eyes spin up to Tanner on the catwalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bellows)

dialogues.speaker: KILL HIM --
dialogues.text: The army of digital guards springing to their feet, laser drawn.

dialogues.speaker: FIFTH FLOOR CATWALK
dialogues.text: Tanner slams in the last of the commands, causing -- A LASER CANNON to materialize next to him.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRS
dialogues.text: The guards charging for Tanner.  There's too many of them He'll never kill them all.

dialogues.speaker: FIFTH FLOOR CATWALK
dialogues.text: Tanner aims the cannon down onto the second floor and

dialogues.speaker: FIRES --
dialogues.text: A program explodes.  The program that controls the waiters. The guards who are reprogrammed waiters disappear. Tanner fires into another program. The guards who are reprogrammed busboys disappear. Tanner keeps firing.  Destroying the employee programs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the guards flicker, then are gone. Dex is the only one left on the stairs as he races up to the catwalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christoph stares up as Tanner rips open the core program and throws in the access card.

dialogues.speaker: FIFTH FLOOR CATWALK
dialogues.text: Data whips across the screen, reflecting off Tanner's face. Tanner suddenly spins. Dex is up on the catwalk, laser trained on Tanner. Tanner reaches for his gun, but he is too late. The HISSING of a laser. Small neat hole burned through Dex's forehead. He crumples to the ground, bloodless face frozen in death Tanner whirls around.  Katie stands behind him, laser in hand.  She is staring at Dex's body.  First time she has killed. A buzzing breaks the silence --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Access approved --

dialogues.speaker: GROUND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Christoph yells up at Tanner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing you need to know! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no Katie out there! (intense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden really did have her killed. (explains)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why the digital one is allowed to stay in here --

dialogues.speaker: CATWALK
dialogues.text: Christoph's warning echoing around Tanner and Katie. She slowly lowers the gun, her eyes shaking as she looks up at Tanner. An anguished silence, broken by Christoph's yelling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me, Tanner?!  She only lives in here! Katie stares at Tanner, struggling for the words, but the won't come. So she leans over and kisses him.  Both of their bodies trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tortured whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already dead... Her eyes wet, she kisses him again, knowing it will be th last time. He forces himself to turn back to the program panel, slamming in the eject sequence. Christoph materializes on the catwalk --

dialogues.speaker: NO --
dialogues.text: He hurls Tanner away from the program panel.  Only he's too late -- That god-awful noise.  Louder and louder. Christoph's face wracked with realization.  Last thing he will do is turn to Tanner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is too precious -- The Nexus Center's walls fade away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buildings are all gone. The LIGHT sweeps down for the people --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie's eyes locked on Tanner. The light explodes through, ripping them all into nothingness --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner is thrown out into the darkness, spinning helplessly through the blackness. The faintest of light.  Growing brighter and brighter, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner's eyes flutter open, struggling for focus. Several blurry shapes.  Tanner pushes himself to sit. The shapes are people.  Halden's bodyguards.  One of them grabs the disk from the chair's interface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see Halden --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm sorry. Tanner turns.  It is EMMA.  She looks tortured by what sh must do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not taking visitors. She motions to the bodyguards, who hustle Tanner to his feet and out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has slowed to a drizzle.  A mud gray day. Emma wishes she didn't have to be the one who had to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F.C.O. regulations require all system providers to test their emergency eject sequence at least once a year. (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our records will show that's exactly what transpired. Before Tanner can respond, she disappears back inside. The sidewalk's crowded, people brushing against Tanner, but he stands there not moving, staring up at the top of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halden sits behind his desk staring out the window. Emma heads inside, laying the disk on the desk. Halden's eyes remain silently out the window. Emma leaves, shutting the door behind her. Halden looks down at the disk.  Smallest flicker of guilt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat-up taxi drops Tanner out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is dark.  Tanner hits the switch. The monitor snaps alive, bathing the room in eerie blue light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Display program received from uplink. Clicking sound as the program drips down the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Program name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resurrection. Tanner nods, making himself a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connect to public access.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (buzzes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Access established.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Select uplink for Federal Communications Office.  Department of Enforcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uplink selected. Tanner settles into a chair, taking a hit of his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uplink Resurrection program. Tanner sits there in the darkness listening to the machines talking to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (buzzes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uplink received. He nods, a flutter of satisfaction. A NOISE from the bedroom.  Sounds like a woman's voice calling out for him. He downs the drink, grabbing his gun and moving into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is empty.  The noise is just the wind howling against the window. He stares at the bed.  Several long beats.  He doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aftermath of the system being ejected. VSI interface attendants passing out credit vouchers as fast as they can to the crush of complaining customers. Tanner squeezes his way inside. His eyes spinning to the back toward Katie, but she's not there. He moves through the crowd trying to find her.  Finally makes his way to the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Katie Hall. The SECURITY GUARD at the desk looks at him like he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect me to find someone in this crowd --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Not a customer.  An employee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Katie works here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been here since we opened. Never been a Katie. Long beat.  Realization ripping through Tanner. He stands there frozen for several dark moments.  Then finally turns and heads out the door. Almost outside when he hears the voice. He spins. Katie. In the back, passing out vouchers.  But then the crowd shifts, blocking his view. He cuts a path to her, his eyes tense, was he imagining her? But he's now standing right next to her.  Can feel her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I please have your debit card. He's staring at her.  Fierce intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, your debit -- He looks down at her name tag.  It reads 'Katherine'.  He nods, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They changed your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did? He stares at her, needs to know.  He reaches out with lightning speed and plucks off her name tag. Before she can react, he grabs her arm, nicking it with the pin from the name tag. She spins, yelling to the security guard --

dialogues.speaker: FRANK --
dialogues.text: The security guard, Frank, hurries over. Tanner watches her arm.  Thin ribbon of blood rising to the cut.  Flicker of relief shudders through him. He stares her straight in the eye --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You grew up in Vermont. She stays silent, not wanting to say anything that'll set this guy off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were six, your father went out to buy a newspaper and never came back. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother lied, told you he was killed in a car accident -- Frank is there now, wrenching Tanner's hands back, twisting them behind his back. Tanner doesn't resist, his eyes locked on Katherine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have trouble remembering your dreams. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's one you always have. She's staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baby's crying.  But no one comes to help it.  So it keeps crying. All night long -- Frank cuffs Tanner, then drags him away. Tanner's eyes struggling for Katie's face, but it's swallowed up by the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner is uncuffed and hurled out into the alley. The sound of the door slamming shut behind him, dead bolt sliding into place. A jet-copter screams by overhead. An old man, face stained with illness, lays on a bed of newspaper next to Tanner. Sounds of the real world filtering down the alley.  A family arguing.  Groups of friends laughing.  Someone screaming. Tanner slowly turns around. Katherine is in the doorway, watching him. Sunlight pierces through the clouds. She tries to keep her voice from trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?... Tanner stares at her, does something he hasn't done in a long time.  He smiles.
